titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas Jenkins, Indictment
CWG1020

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p: Be it remembered that on Nov 28th 1865 the Grand Jury impannelled for the County of Mercer found the following indictment

The Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs } Mercer County Circuit Court
Thomas Jenkins

The Grand Jury of Mercer County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Thomas Jenkins of the Crime of rape committed as follows: The said Thomas Jenkins on the 10th day of September 1865, in the County aforesiad forcibly, unlawfully and against her will and consent carnally knew Lettee Gray a white woman against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

Witness before the Jury
Lettae Gray, William Vandavier
Mr Gray -- husband, Richard Reed
E. E. Reed

L. H. Noble
Att'y for Commonwealth,

A True Bill,
J. B. Irvin
Foreman of Grand Jury
1865 Nov 28 found & filed
Richard Board clk,

I Richard Board Clerk of the Mercer Circuit do hereby certify that the above is a true and correct copy of the ^foregoing^ Indictment found in the above Court & the same is ^of Record and^ on file in my office
Richard Board C M. C, C,
